title: Crystal Collector
description: My first attempt at using jQuery. This game presents the user with four crystal with hidden number values, and a random number which is their goal. The user must click on the crystal to increase the score to match the random number exactly. If they go over, they lose. If they match it, they win.

title: GoT Trivia
description: In The Game of Thrones Trivia you win... or you die! This is a trivia game utilizing JavaScript's native timer functions to loop users through an array of questions in the form of cards. It evaluates uers choices and responds with an appropriate gif.

title: D&D Scraper
description: This handlebars based application utilizes two node packages (axios and cheerio) to allow users to scrape two separate D&D related news sites for the most recent articles, and saves those articles to the database. Users can also comment on articles.

title: Remington Memory Game
description: A React application memory game! Users click on different paintings done by Frederic Remington. Clicking on different images increments their score, clicking on the same image causes them to lose and resets their score. (It takes a moment to load).

title: Bike Right Back
description: Voted the most socially conscious app two times in a row! Bike Right Back utilizes handlebars, postgresSQL, express, and node to provide a theft-prevention and recovery application for bicyclists everywhere. Users can search an area to see how many bikes have been reported stolen in that vicinity, allowing them to decide if they should ride their bike there. They can also create an account, register their bike with the Bike Right Back database, and if they report their bike stolen it will appear on the front page as an alert!

title: Merry Meet
description: Merry Meet is a location-based social networking app that allows Pagans and Wiccans to drop markers in favorite hang out spots that produce chatrooms based in that area. It is meant to encourage face-to-face interaction. It utilizes React, Express, Node, and MongoDB, along with Cloudinary, Multer, and React-Google-Maps.
